description.narrative: By 2016 drinking water points are available for at least 70% of people in targeted areas of the programme (including 70% of health facilities (FOSA) and 50% of primary schools) and a community management and maintenance system for hand pumps is developed and functional.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016 drinking water points are available for at least 70% of people in targeted areas of the programme (including 70% of health facilities (FOSA) and 50% of primary schools); and a community management and maintenance system for hand pumps is developed and functional.

description.narrative: 129,500 people have access to drinking water through community water point construction composed of 112 new water points and the rehabilitation of 136 boreholes. 160 water point management committees (WPMC) were set up or reactivated to ensure adequate management and regular maintenance and community ownership. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:15/01/2018
